clinical_study.brief_title: Berberine Treat Metabolic Syndrome in Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: Berberine in the Treatment of Metabolic Syndrome : an Open Label Clinical Study in Female Schizophrenia Patients

brief_summary.textblock: In early clinical study investigators confirmed that berberine could prevent glucose and lipid metabolism disorder in schizophrenia, so investigators intend to verify the effect and safety of berberine in treatment for metabolic syndrome in schizophrenia.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is an open lable clinical intervention trial, include 30 female subjects with diagnosis of schizophrenia and metabolic syndrome.Participants will be given berberine（ 300mgTID） as an add-on therapy lasting 8 weeks.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline serum fasting biood glucose at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline serum triglyceride at 8 weeks
Change from Baseline serum low density lipoprotein at 8 weeks
Change from Baseline Systolic Blood Pressure at 8 weeks
Change from Baseline waistline at 8 weeks
Change from Baseline Diastolic Blood Pressure at 8 weeks

arm_group.description: Only one treatment group in this study, without a preset control group,subjects who meet the criteria will entere the berberine adjunctive group

intervention.description: berberine 300mg TID add-on for berberine adjunctive group
